data.title: Car Rental in Drammen | Lowest Price Guarantee
data.meta_description: Pick up your car rental in Drammen, and get ready to traverse Norway's enchanting landscapes. Take advantage of special offers and discounts on car rentals.
data.text:
1. How much does it cost to rent a car in Drammen?

The cost of renting a car in Drammen can vary depending on the type of car, rental duration, and the season. On average, you can expect to pay between 500 to 1500 NOK per day.

2. What car model is most demanded for rent in Drammen?

Compact cars and SUVs are usually the most demanded in Drammen. This is largely due to their suitability for both city driving and trips to nearby attractions such as Spiralen - a unique tunnel road spiraling up a mountain offering stunning views.

3. Where are the popular places to rent a car in Drammen?

Popular car rental locations include Drammen city center and Alvdal Airport.

4. Is there a 24 hour pick-up and drop-off service?

Most of the car rental companies in Drammen offer 24 hour pick-up and drop-off services for maximum convenience of their customers.

5. What is the minimum car rental duration?

The minimum car rental period is usually one day (24 hours).

6. What is the minimum age requirement to rent a car in Drammen?

The minimum age to rent a car in Drammen is typically 19 years, although this can vary between rental companies. An additional young driver fee may apply to drivers under 25 years.

7. What documents do I need to rent or drive a car in Drammen?

Typically, you will need a valid driver’s license, passport, and a credit card. Your license needs to be written in the Latin alphabet. An International Driver’s Permit might be required if your license is not in English.

8. When is the best time of the year to visit Drammen by car?

The best time to visit Drammen by car is from May to September when the weather is warmer. Driving in the winter can be challenging due to snow and ice, but it also offers an amazing scenic drive.

9. What are the main airports in Drammen?

The main airports in and around Drammen are Oslo Airport, Sandefjord Airport and Alvdal Airport.

10. Can I pick up the car in Drammen and return it in another city?

Yes, most car rental companies in Drammen offer a one-way rental service. Some companies might charge an additional drop-off fee for this service.

1. On which side of the road do cars drive in Drammen?

Cars in Drammen, like the rest of Norway, drive on the right-hand side of the road.

2. What is the general speed limit in Drammen?

The general speed limit in built-up areas is 50 km/h, while on highways it is typically 80 km/h or 100 km/h.

3. Is it mandatory to have a driving license to drive in Drammen?

Yes, a valid driving license is required to drive in Drammen, and it must be carried at all times when driving.

4. Are there many speed radars in Drammen?

Yes, several speed radars are placed across Drammen and other cities in Norway to enforce speed limits.

5. Are there any specific driving rules I should be aware of?

Always yield to pedestrians at zebra crossings. Also, you must always drive with your headlights on, even during daytime.

6. How heavy is the traffic in Drammen?

Traffic can get heavy during rush hours but is generally manageable. Plan your journeys ahead to avoid any delays.

7. Can I use my foreign driving license in Drammen?

Yes, most foreign driving licenses are valid for the first three months. However, it is always a good idea to check with the Norwegian Public Roads Administration.

8. Are there tolls on Norwegian roads?

Yes, there are many toll stations throughout Norway. Some accept cash, but many are electronic and require an AutoPASS or payment in advance.

9. Is it necessary to have winter tires in Drammen?

From November 1st until the first Monday after Easter Monday, it is mandatory to have winter tires if the conditions require it.

10. Are school zones regulated differently?

Yes, when children are going in or out of school, a speed limit of 30 km/h is usually applied. Be prepared to stop for school buses.

11. Are roundabouts common in Drammen?

Yes, roundabouts are common and follow the rule of giving priority to cars already circulating in the roundabout.

12. Is it mandatory to use seat belts?

Yes, it's mandatory for the driver and all passengers to use seat belts.

13. Are there services areas/rest areas on the highways?

Yes, there are rest areas along the highways.

14. How do I pay for parking in Drammen?

You can pay for parking at ticket machines with coins, credit card or mobile apps.

15. Can foreigners rent cars in Drammen?

Yes, as long as they provide a valid driving license and fulfill the age requirements for driving.
